notes.text:
Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.6.7-1 - RHEL7 Container

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of
Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Security Fix(es):

* Addressed a security issue which can allow a malicious playbook author to elevate to the awx user from outside the isolated environment: CVE-2021-20253
* Upgraded to a more recent version of nginx to address CVE-2019-20372
* Upgraded to a more recent version of autobahn to address CVE-2020-35678
* Upgraded to a more recent version of jquery to address CVE-2020-11022 and CVE-2020-11023

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

full_product_name.name: ansible-tower-36/ansible-tower@sha256:b693ff9d898bc14a776b881bc8c868a7c3472456d6f009bb81d4dd5f85835e28_amd64 as a component of Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.6 for RHEL 7

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: NGINX before 1.17.7, with certain error_page configurations, allows HTTP request smuggling, as demonstrated by the ability of an attacker to read unauthorized web pages in environments where NGINX is being fronted by a load balancer.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nginx: HTTP request smuggling in configurations with URL redirect used as error_page
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

vulnerabilities.title: nginx: HTTP request smuggling in configurations with URL redirect used as error_page

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in JQuery. This flaw allows an attacker with the ability to supply input to the âHTMLâ function to inject Javascript into the page where that input is rendered, and have it delivered by the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: No supported release of Red Hat OpenStack Platform is affected by this vulnerability as no shipped packages contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in jQuery. HTML containing \<option\> elements from untrusted sources are passed, even after sanitizing, to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods, which may execute untrusted code. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions 6, 7, and 8 ship a vulnerable version of JQuery in the `pcs` component. As PCS does not accept untrusted input, the vulnerable code cannot be controlled by an attacker.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods

cwe.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

notes.text: A flaw was found in python-autobahn, where it allows redirect header injection. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: python-autobahn: allows redirect header injection
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In Red Hat OpenStack Platform, because the flaw has a lower impact and the fix would require a substantial amount of development, no update will be provided at this time for the RHOSP python-autobahn package.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

cwe.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties

notes.text: A flaw was found in ansible-tower. The default installation is vulnerable to Job Isolation escape allowing an attacker to elevate the privilege from a low privileged user to the awx user from outside the isolated environment. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ansible-tower: Privilege escalation via job isolation escape
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: ansible-tower: Privilege escalation via job isolation escape
